TopicTitle: PSA - you can build open ended fairings and combine them - with a little trick

Articles.Content:
So I found out you can create for instance an interstage fairing consisting of two parts. I order to do that you first have to create an interstage fairing, launch the vehicle, revert to VAB, remove everything on top of the fairing (the fairing stays) then build on top of the things inside the fairing, put another fairing on top and connect it (with the trick of offsetting stuff in between). It's a bit hard for me to explain, that's why I made a video:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/i_3KBCj1lXk?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Best method I've seen so far. I would still like Squad to fix it so we can do this a lot easier than using part clipping exploits. One advantage to this method is that it is closer to the real Apollo, which staged off the engine shroud exposing the top portion of the lander. You could do that by staging your upper fairing and leaving the lower one intact.

This is neat, but it makes me sad that SQUAD never made it so you can go through the middle of stack decouplers / separators.
